paper_abstract: Distributed data management systems consist of peers that store, exchange and process data in order to collaboratively achieve a common goal, such as evaluating some query. We study the equivalence of such systems. We model a distributed system by a collection of Active XML documents, i.e., trees augmented with function calls for performing tasks such as sending, receiving and querying data. As our model is quite general, the equivalence problem turns out to be undecidable. However, we exhibit several restrictions of the model, for which equivalence can be effectively decided. We also study the computational complexity of the equivalence problem, and present an axiomatization of equivalence, in the form of a set of equivalence-preserving rewrite rules allowing us to optimize a system by rewriting it into an equivalent, but possibly more efficient system. paper_title: On the equivalence of distributed systems with queries and communication
